content:
Yes, some notable artists and workshops that specialized in creating illuminated manuscripts include:

1. The Limbourg Brothers - a workshop of three Dutch brothers who created the famous Très Riches Heures du Duc de Berry manuscript.
2. The Book of Kells - a manuscript created by Irish monks in the 9th century.
3. The Tresor de Montsegur - a collection of manuscripts created by a group of Cathars in the 14th century.
4. The Winchester Bible - a manuscript illuminated by a team of artists in England in the 12th century.
5. The Hours of Catherine of Cleves - a manuscript created in the Netherlands in the 15th century.
